Part 2¶

This is part two of Assignment 1

Car module¶

Action Enum¶

class Part2.Car2.Action[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

An enum class used to represent actions for cars.

DRIVE = 1¶

Drive action variable (is 1).

Type:DRIVE (int)
WAIT = 0¶

Wait action variable (is 0).

Type:WAIT (int)

Car Class¶

class Part2.Car2.Car(score: int = 0, speed: int = 1)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for representing a car in simulation.

action = 0¶

Action currently chosen by car (default is WAIT).

Type:action (Action)
decay_factor = 0.5¶

Decay factor for car (default is 0.5).

Type:decay_factor (float)
distance_on_bridge = 0¶

How far car has driven on bridge (default is 0).

Type:distance_on_bridge (int)
get_reward() → int[source]¶

Returns reward for car based on its action.

Returns:Reward for action, -1 for wait, 100 for drive.
Return type:int
learn_factor = 0.9¶

Learning factor for car (default is 0.9).

Type:learn_factor (float)
print_data() → None[source]¶

Prints out score, state, action and Q-matrix for car to console.

q_matrix = None¶

List of q values.

Must be set in simulation based on bridge’s capacity (default is list()).

Type:q_matrix (List[float])
r_matrix = None¶

Reward matrix for the car (default is [-1, 100]).

Type:r_matrix (List[int])
reward_action(reward: int) → None[source]¶

Rewards action taken by car using Q-Learning algorithm.

Using reward argument and Q-Learning algorithm learns the car to take actions. Updates score for car.

Parameters:reward (int) – Reward value, can be negative.
score = 0¶

Overall score for the car.

Type:score(int)
scores = None¶

List of scores for car (default is list()).

Type:scores (List[int])
speed = 1¶

Car’s speed, how many tiles it moves during a turn.

Type:speed (int)
state = 0¶

Current state (default is 0).

Type:state (int)
take_action(cars_on_bridge: int) → None[source]¶

Takes action for car based on bridge’s current state and Q matrix.

If all possible actions have equal Q value, it takes random action, highest values action otherwise.

Bridge module¶

Bridge Class¶

class Part2.Bridge2.Bridge(capacity: int = 5, length: int = 10)[source]¶

Bases: object

Bridge class simulating the behaviour of bridge in simulation.

On can set specific length and capacity for the bridge to change the overall behaviour of bridge in the simulation and see how it impacts the scores for cars.

capacity = 5¶

Set amount of cars that the bridge can accommodate before collapsing.

cars = None¶

List of all of the cars that are currently on the bridge.

collapse_bridge() → List[Car2.Car][source]¶

Returns a list of all cars on bridge and sets cars to empty list.

Returns:List of cars that were on bridge when it collapsed.
Return type:List[Car]
has_collapsed() → bool[source]¶

Simple method to check if bridge has collapsed.

Returns:True if bridge has collapsed, False otherwise.
Return type:bool
length = 10¶

Length of bridge deciding how much time a car will use to cross it.

move_cars() → List[Car2.Car][source]¶

Moves cars across the bridge and returns cars that have crossed it.

Returns:List of cars that have crossed the bridge this turn.
Return type:List[Car]

Simulation module¶

Simulation Class¶

class Part2.Simulation2.Simulation(bridge: Bridge2.Bridge, carpool: List[Car2.Car], lamb: float = 1.5, debug: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for simulating fixed capacity bridge crossing problem.

It takes in a list of cars that will try crossing a bridge with a fixed capacity. It tries to teach them to not drive on the bridge if it is at its full capacity, without telling the cars what the capacity is.

bridge = None¶

Bridge used in simulation

carpool = None¶

List of cars that are not on bridge or in queue.

debug = False¶

Boolean that decides whether or not to print some extra info to console.

get_new_cars() → None[source]¶

Method for getting cars from carpool into queue.

give_reward(car: Car2.Car) → None[source]¶

Gives rewards to car based on its action, if bridge collapses reset cars.

Firstly it finds the reward for car and calls reward action method, before checking if bridge has collapsed, if it did it moves cars from bridge back into carpool.

lamb = 1.5¶

Lambda value for Poisson distribution

queue = None¶

List of cars waiting to cross the bridge.

show_graph() → None[source]¶

Shows graph with scores for each car after simulation.

simulate_turns(no_turns: int) → None[source]¶

Simulates a given amount of turns for the cars.

This method starts by instantiating Q matrices for cars based on bridge capacity and then it simulates turns. For each turn it takes some cars from carpool and moves them to queue (number depends of Poisson distribution). Cars on bridge get to move and then the cars in queue get to decide whether to move or not, and are rewarded based on their actions. After the turns it shows score graph for cars.

Parameters:no_turns (int) – Number of turns to simulate.
take_action(car: Car2.Car) → None[source]¶

Lets car in queue take an action, if it drives it gets put on bridge.
